cpnv.jav1.lima
Class LimaDb

java.lang.Object
  cpnv.jav1.lima.LimaDb

public class LimaDb
extends java.lang.Object

Allows querying a remote database using a web service. The SQL query is sent by HTTP POST to the service, which sends data back in XML. The data returned is parsed in LimaDb and made available to the user through public methods

Version:
1.0
Author:
Xavier

Field Summary
 java.lang.String LIMA_ERROR_FIELD_DOES_NOT_EXIST
          Constant indicating that the user tried to read the value of a field that is not present in the data returned

Field Detail

LIMA_ERROR_FIELD_DOES_NOT_EXIST

public final java.lang.String LIMA_ERROR_FIELD_DOES_NOT_EXIST
Constant indicating that the user tried to read the value of a field that is not present in the data returned

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

LimaDb

public LimaDb(java.lang.String wsURL)
Parameters:
wsURL - The URL of the web service, i.e: to which the query will be POSTed
Method Detail

connectionIsOK

public boolean connectionIsOK()
Checks if the Lima database is available

Returns:
true if the connection to the web service and the the database is good

executeQuery

public int executeQuery(java.lang.String query)
Executes the query and returns the number of affected or selected records
A negative value indicates that an error occurred
In the case of a SELECT, the first record has NOT been read at this point

Parameters:
query - The SQL query to execute on the remote server
Returns:
The number of affected or selected records

moveNext

public boolean moveNext()
Reads the next record from the current recordset

Returns:
true if a record was successfully read, false if there was no more records or the XML returned was bad

getField

public java.lang.String getField(java.lang.String fname)
Reads the value of a field in the current record

Parameters:
fname - the name of the field to read
Returns:
The value of the field "fname" of the current record, or the constant LIMA_ERROR_FIELD_DOES_NOT_EXIST if the field does not exist in the record
